alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:10AM EST until December 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... South Branch Raritan River At Stanton affecting Hunterdon and Somerset Counties. For the Raritan River...including Stanton, Raritan, Manville, Bound Brook...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Raritan River at Stanton. * WHEN...From early this morning to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding downstream of gauge. At 8.0 feet, Right bank and approach to bridge is flooded. At 10.0 feet, Houses downstream begin to take on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EST Monday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 10/19/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date South Branch Rar Stanton 8.0 8.8 Mon 5 am 7.0 4.6 9.9 1pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
